geometry.planar

Class TileShape

  • java.lang.Object
    • geometry.planar.PolylineShape
      • geometry.planar.TileShape
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    Area, ConvexShape, Shape, java.io.Serializable
    Direct Known Subclasses:
    RegularTileShape, Simplex

    public abstract class TileShape
extends PolylineShape
implements ConvexShape, java.io.Serializable
    Abstract class defining functionality for convex shapes, whose borders consists of straight lines.
    Version:
    $Id: $Id
    Author:
    Alfons Wirtz
    See Also:
    Serialized Form

      Returns the content of the area of the shape.

      Returns the distance between p_point and its nearest point on the border of the shape.

      if p_line is a borderline of this shape the number of that edge is returned, otherwise -1

      Returns the p_no-th border line of this shape.

      Returns true, if this shape contains p_other completely.

      Returns true, if p_point is contained in this shape with tolerance p_tolerance.

      Returns true, if this shape contains p_other completely.

      Cuts out the parts of p_polyline in the interiour of this shape and returns a list of the remaining pieces of p_polyline.
      abstract TileShape[] cutout(TileShape p_shape)
      Cuts p_shape out of this shape and divides the result into convex pieces
      FloatLine diagonal_corner_segment()
      Returns a line segment consisting of an approximations of the corners with index 0 and corner_count / 2.
      double distance_to_the_left(Line p_line)
      Calculates the minimal distance of p_line to this shape, assuming, that p_line is on the left of this shape.
      double distance(FloatPoint p_point)
      Returns the distance between p_point and its nearest point on the shape. 0, if p_point is contained in this shape
      TileShape[] divide_into_sections(double p_max_section_width)
      Divides this shape into sections with width and height at most p_max_section_width of about equal size.
      int[][] entrance_points(Polyline p_polyline)
      Returns an arry of tuples of integers.

      Returns the number of a nearest corner of the shape to p_from_point

      Calculates the border line of this shape intersecting the ray from p_from_point into the direction p_direction.

      Tries to simplify the result shape to a simpler shape.

      Returns an approximation of the p_count nearest points to p_from_point on the border of the this shape.
      FloatPoint nearest_point_approx(FloatPoint p_from_point)
      Calculates an approximation of the nearest point of the shape to p_from_point
      Point nearest_point(Point p_from_point)
      Returns the point in this shape, which has the smallest distance to p_from_point. p_from_point, if that point is contained in this shape
      FloatPoint[] nearest_relative_outside_locations(TileShape p_shape, int p_count)
      Returns an approximation of the p_count nearest relative outside locations of p_shape in the direction of different border lines of this shape.

      Rotates the area around p_pole by p_angle.
      ConvexShape shrink(double p_offset)
      Shrinks the shape by p_offset.

      Returns Side.COLLINEAR if p_point is on the border of this shape with tolerance p_tolerence.
      Side side_of(Line p_line)
      Returns Side.COLLINEAR, if p_line intersects with the interiour of this shape, Side.ON_THE_LEFT, if this shape is completely on the left of p_line or Side.ON_THE_RIGHT, if this shape is completely on the right of p_line.

      • border_line

        public abstract Line border_line(int p_no)
        Returns the p_no-th border line of this shape. Returns the p_no-th edge line of this shape for p_no between 0 and edge_line_count() - 1. The edge lines are sorted in counterclock sense around the shape starting with the edge with the smallest direction.
        Specified by:
        border_line in class PolylineShape
        Parameters:
        p_no - a int.
        Returns:
        a Line object.

      • contains

        public boolean contains(FloatPoint p_point,
                        double p_tolerance)
        Returns true, if p_point is contained in this shape with tolerance p_tolerance. p_tolerance is used when determing, if a point is on the left side of a border line. It is used there in calculating a determinant and is not the distance of p_point to the border.
        Parameters:
        p_point - a FloatPoint object.
        p_tolerance - a double.
        Returns:
        a boolean.

      • side_of_border

        public Side side_of_border(FloatPoint p_point,
                           double p_tolerance)
        Returns Side.COLLINEAR if p_point is on the border of this shape with tolerance p_tolerence. p_tolerance is used when determing, if a point is on the right side of a border line. It is used there in calculating a determinant and is not the distance of p_point to the border. Otherwise the function returns Side.ON_THE_LEFT if p_point is outside of this shape, and Side.ON_THE_RIGTH if p_point is inside this shape.
        Parameters:
        p_point - a FloatPoint object.
        p_tolerance - a double.
        Returns:
        a Side object.

        Returns:
        a int.

      • nearest_border_points_approx

        public FloatPoint[] nearest_border_points_approx(FloatPoint p_from_point,
                                                 int p_count)
        Returns an approximation of the p_count nearest points to p_from_point on the border of the this shape. The result points must be located on different border lines and are sorted in ascending order (the nearest point comes first).
        Parameters:
        p_from_point - a FloatPoint object.
        p_count - a int.
        Returns:
        an array of FloatPoint objects.

        Returns:
        a int.

        Returns:
        a FloatLine object.

      • nearest_relative_outside_locations

        public FloatPoint[] nearest_relative_outside_locations(TileShape p_shape,
                                                       int p_count)
        Returns an approximation of the p_count nearest relative outside locations of p_shape in the direction of different border lines of this shape. These relative locations are sorted in ascending order (the shortest comes first).
        Parameters:
        p_shape - a TileShape object.
        p_count - a int.
        Returns:
        an array of FloatPoint objects.

        public double length()

        Returns:
        a double.

      • touching_sides

        public int[] touching_sides(TileShape p_other)
        Calculates, if this Shape and p_other habe a common border piece and returns an 2 dimensional array with the indices in this shape and p_other of the touching edge lines in this case. Otherwise an array of dimension 0 is returned. Used if the intersection shape is 1-dimensional.
        Parameters:
        p_other - a TileShape object.
        Returns:
        an array of int.

      • distance_to_the_left

        public double distance_to_the_left(Line p_line)
        Calculates the minimal distance of p_line to this shape, assuming, that p_line is on the left of this shape. Returns -1, if p_line is on the right of this shape or intersects with the interiour of this shape.
        Parameters:
        p_line - a Line object.
        Returns:
        a double.

      • side_of

        public Side side_of(Line p_line)
        Returns Side.COLLINEAR, if p_line intersects with the interiour of this shape, Side.ON_THE_LEFT, if this shape is completely on the left of p_line or Side.ON_THE_RIGHT, if this shape is completely on the right of p_line.
        Parameters:
        p_line - a Line object.
        Returns:
        a Side object.

      • intersecting_border_line_no

        public int intersecting_border_line_no(Point p_from_point,
                                       Direction p_direction)
        Calculates the border line of this shape intersecting the ray from p_from_point into the direction p_direction. p_from_point is assumed to be inside this shape, otherwise -1 is returned.

      • cutout

        public abstract TileShape[] cutout(TileShape p_shape)
        Cuts p_shape out of this shape and divides the result into convex pieces
        Parameters:
        p_shape - a TileShape object.
        Returns:
        an array of TileShape objects.

      • entrance_points

        public int[][] entrance_points(Polyline p_polyline)
        Returns an arry of tuples of integers. The length of the array is the number of points, where p_polyline enters or leaves the interiour of this shape. The first coordinate of the tuple is the number of the line segment of p_polyline, which enters the simplex and the second coordinate of the tuple is the number of the edge_line of the simplex, which is crossed there. That means that the entrance point is the intersection of this 2 lines.
        Parameters:
        p_polyline - a Polyline object.
        Returns:
        an array of int.

      • cutout

        public Polyline[] cutout(Polyline p_polyline)
        Cuts out the parts of p_polyline in the interiour of this shape and returns a list of the remaining pieces of p_polyline. Pieces completely contained in the border of this shape are not returned. Cuts out the parts of p_polyline in the interiour of this shape and returns a list of the remaining pieces of p_polyline. Pieces completely contained in the border of this shape are not returned.
        Specified by:
        cutout in interface Shape
        Parameters:
        p_polyline - a Polyline object.
        Returns:
        an array of Polyline objects.

        Returns:

      • is_intersected_interiour_by

        public boolean is_intersected_interiour_by(LineSegment p_line_segment)
        Checks, if p_line_segment has a common point with the interiour of this shape.
        Parameters:
        p_line_segment - a LineSegment object.
        Returns:
        a boolean.
